description.value:
The army's morale has begun to falter, be it fear in the face of a powerful enemy, a supernatural effect such as a dragon's frightful presence, or simply the result of ill fortune in the tide of battle.

Shaken always has a numerical value. The army's Morale checks take a circumstance penalty equal to its shaken value, and whenever the army takes damage, it must succeed on a @Check[type:flat|dc:11] or its shaken value increases by 1. An army that becomes shaken 4 is automatically @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.kingmaker-features.Item.Routed]. An army reduces the value of this condition by 1 each Kingdom turn that passes during which it does not attempt an Army activity or engage in a war encounter.
